results.title: A Saucer of water for the birds
results.brief_description: An animated short. A woman and her grandmother sit together playing cards. As they are shuffled and dealt, the film cuts between pre-war Poland, Europe during the Holocaust, the woman’s childhood, and the present. A meditation on the relationship between public history and personal memory, as it is played out in the dynamics of the family.

results.title: A Run for your money
results.creator_credit: Charles Cahill and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description: A Japanese uses about one quarter of the energy used by an American. When fuel economy counts, it is important to watch driving habits, it is also important to use smaller cars, not carry heavy things unless necessary, not over utilise air conditioning and make sure that the cars used receive regular maintenance.

results.title: A Rosewood daydream
results.brief_description: This is the name of a Toronto folk group - two young men, a blue-eyed woman, and a guitar. They sing outdoors, indoors, wherever there’s a friendly audience. Most of the “with it” listeners in this film are the old folks in a home for the aged in St. John’s, Newfoundland. To them the group sings old songs of the sea, and a popular tune, Louis Collins, by Mississippi John Hurt.

results.title: A Road is built
results.brief_description: A study of the use of heavy mechanical equipment during the building of a road in the timber country near Noogee in Victoria. Bulldozers, rooters, power-graders, and heavy earth-moving machines are seen at work as the road takes shape.

results.title: A Return to the Rocks
results.creator_credit: John Fitzgerald, David Beal, Audience Motivation and Sydney Cove Redevelopment Authority
results.brief_description: The history of Sydney Cove and the Rocks area, shown by means of sketches, paintings, photographs and dramatisations. The Sydney Cove Redevelopment Authority has been set up to preserve the unique character of the area. Shows some of the Australia Day celebrations at the birth place of the nation. Narrated by Peter Gwynne and Tim Eliott. Written by David Whitaker. Cinematography John Fitzgerald, Oscar Scherl, Ian Stock and Foster Stubbs.

results.title: A Research brief 2
results.creator_credit: AKO, National Research Council of Canada and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Projects undertaken by the National Research Council of Canada. This film covers the development of a new meningitis vaccine; a process to extract protein from field peas; maintenance of the NRC cesium atomic clock, solar energy research, and grinding and polishing a 14-ton mirror for the Canada-France-Hawaii telescope. Photographers, John McAulay, Grant Crabtree, Ian McKain.

results.title: A Research brief
results.creator_credit: AKO, National Research Council of Canada and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This film covers the following National Research Council projects at fort-aux-Basques harbour, Newfoundland - simulated icing of helicopters, the comet kohoutek, seaweeds, seals, an updated windmill, automation on the farm, and a revolutionary highway safety installation. Photographers, Grant Crabtree, John McAulay, Ken Orton.

results.title: A Recital of faith
results.brief_description: In 1940 R.S. Reynolds and his metals company were concerned at the low volume of US aluminium production. They decided to produce enough to make 50,000 planes. A new plant was built the same year and was in operation only five months later. The manufacturing processes of making aluminium is shown in detail.

results.title: A Real rodeo. Fun fair. Felix out of luck. [compilation]
results.brief_description: A compilation of three short films. 1. A Real rodeo: Roping and typing a steer contest; horse and rider in bucking contest; steer bulldogging; queen of the rodeo. 2. Fun fair: Swing high - swing low; the gypsy’s warning; on the target; merry-go-round; steam-boat swing 3. Felix out of luck: animated cartoon.

results.title: A Rat in the building
results.brief_description: This clever clay animation film centres around a gathering of elderly women neighbours who meet for their weekly gossip. Item number one on the agenda, “rats” (whom one presumes represents men), and those women who are devilish enough to keep them in a building that prohibits their existence. Adapted from a short story by Olga Masters and featuring the voices of Penny Biggins and Gretel Killeen.
